page.title: 12A "COFFIN DROP"
page.content: At the end of Sparry Lane in Carharrack is an old cottage.It is a traditional granite building which has remained largely unchanged for many years.It was probably built to house a local{mine worker}and his family. One interesting feature of this cottage is that there is a{"Coffin {Drop".}The staircase is very steep and narrow which makes it impossible for a coffin to be removed from an upstairs room,so a hole has been specially cut in the ceiling. When a person died they were often{ {"Laid Out"}on their bed or placed in an open coffin so that friends and family could pay their{last respects.} When it was time for the{funeral}the specially cut floorboards were removed leaving a hole through which the coffin could be lowered. SELINA BELL. MELANIE PICKETT.
